SENT.plain: In this study, the reproducibility of T(2) * MR imaging in colorectal liver metastases was assessed and T(2) * values were correlated with the expression of the hypoxia-related markers GLUT-1 and CA-IX as well as the relative vascular area, and the vessel density in resected tumors
The reproducibility of T(2) * was analyzed in 18 patients with in total 22 colorectal liver metastases using the Bland and Altman method for the 16th, 50th, and 84th percentile values
Immunohistochemical staining was performed on 17 resected tumors obtained from 16 patients
The median T(2) * of all liver metastases was 25.0 ± 5.6 ms vs. 23.0 ± 4.1 ms (median ± st.dev.) in normal liver
The coefficient of repeatability was 11.2 ms and the limits of agreement were -13.2 ms and 9.1 ms for median T(2) * values
On average, T(2) * showed fair reproducibility
No correlations between T(2) * values, hypoxia- and vascularity-related markers were observed
